alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Forest; Lawrence; Mercer; Venango (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 12:41AM EST until January 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow, possibly heavy at times, will continue overnight. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches are likely through 8 AM, the heaviest of which is expected along and north of US Highway 30, including the Ohio Turnpike and Interstate 80. Gusty northwest winds of 25 to 35 mph are expected to develop by mid to late morning, perhaps leading to areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Eastern Ohio, the northern West Virginia panhandle, and northwest Pennsylvania along and north of Interstate 80. * WHEN...Until 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will remain slick and hazardous. Travel will remain extremely difficult and will impact this morning`s commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should delay all travel if possible until Monday afternoon at the earliest. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution and be prepared for sudden changes in visibility. Leave plenty of room between you and the motorist ahead of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Avoid sudden braking or acceleration, and be especially cautious on hills or when making turns. Make sure your car is winterized and in good working order.
